qas.question: What theories began to be put in wider practice?
What does equal temperament enabled in hard to tune keyboard instruments?

answers.text: a wider range of chromatic possibilities

qas.question: A modern piano is generally what?
What system of temperaments was common during Bach's time?

context: The theories surrounding <a0_0>equal temperament<a0_0/> began to be put in wider practice, especially as it enabled <a1_0>a wider range of chromatic possibilities<a1_0/> in hard-to-tune keyboard instruments. Although Bach did not use <a2_0>equal temperament<a2_0/>, as a modern piano is generally <a3_0>tuned<a3_0/>, changes in the temperaments from the <a4_0>meantone<a4_0/> system, common at the time, to various temperaments that made modulation between all keys musically acceptable, made possible Bach's Well-Tempered Clavier.
